overview:
Scott Blake Harris joined Neustar in March 2011. He is responsible for the company’s legal, regulatory, public policy, communications, marketing and corporate responsibility functions.

Prior to joining Neustar, Mr. Harris served as General Counsel of the United States Department of Energy, where he also served as co-chair of the Broadband Subcommittee of the Obama Administrationâ€™s National Science and Technology Council.

Mr. Harris previously served in government as Chief of the International Bureau at the Federal Communications Commission, and Chief Counsel for Export Administration at the United States Department of Commerce. In the private sector, Mr. Harris was the Managing Partner of Harris, Wiltshire & Grannis LLP, a nationally recognized law firm he founded in 1998; and a partner in the law firms of Williams & Connolly LLP and Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP. He is a magna cum laude graduate of both Harvard Law School and Brown University, where he was also a member of Phi Beta Kappa.
